item.title: Bikes blocking pavement and junction, 12th August
item.description:
Bikes are constantly parked perpendicular to the pavement on the double yellow line at the junction where Bernays Grove turns right into Brighton Terrace. It's dangerous for vehicles turning, obstructing side and view, and it is dangerous for pedestrians who cannot cross at this point. This was reported 8 months ago and has not changed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Brighton Terrace, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All goose green bins massively overflowing, 12th August
item.description:
A disgusting amount of waste and dog poo overflowing out of the bins - particularly the one at the East Dulwich Road entrance and causing masses of flies.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, East Dulwich Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Main road traffic is being diverted down side street, 12th August
item.description:
Since Hertford Road has been shut Northbound despite an official diversion using Church Street, nearly all the main road traffic is using Oxford Road to bypass the closed section of the road. This is causing continuous road rage incidents and horns as its a single track road. On top of this the constant flow of traffic, most of it going fast is extremely noisy and bad on air pollution Furthermore because its a single track road cars are constantly reversing in and out of parking bays to give was coming extremely close to parked cars. The road needs to be closed at one end of made one way southbound
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxford Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of animal excrement on pavement, 12th August
item.description:
There was a carrier bag full of mess and an upturned plate that was full of what looked like diarrhoea left on the pavement outside number 8 Bennett Close. We already have an existing complaint with L&Q about them. We moved it not realising how bad it was under the plate. We moved the bag onto their garden but the mess is smeared all over the pavement and is now covered in flies. My son covered it with cat litter just to stop people walking through it. It is a health hazard and the flies are coming in my house!!! Please can something be done about this. The tenant in number 8 has now gone on holiday so won't be there but her teenage daughter is there looking after the animals.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bennett Close, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Problem not fixed, 12th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Druid Street, The Borough, London

item.title: Overhanging hedging on Alsike Road, 12th August
item.description:
There's is currently overhanging hedging almost completely blocking the pavement on Alsike Road just before the Shell recharge point lamp post (walking towards Lanridge Road). This has been like this for a couple of months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alsike Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
